Issues.Title: Investigate Rendering Performance differences based on hardware/VMs/RDP
Issues.Body:
From personal contacts to the German IT Industry (Desktop UI Development, huge LOB apps), I am getting mixed messages about certain aspects of GDI and GDI+ rendering on different machines.

There is a (very carefully assumed) pattern emerging, that Highend Graphic cards seem to have issues with rendering performance, while the performance on RPD or VMs is better to MUCH better.

This is a experience report item, and a reminder, to get this investigated and then planned to be addressed in the .NET 10-time-frame.

@JeremyKuhne FYI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Investigate Rendering Performance differences based on hardware/VMs/RDP" (#11818)

Issues.Title: Non-SDK NETFX4.8 project referencing .netstandard2.0 - PlatformNotSupportedException
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET Framework 4.8 / netstandard2.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Upon calling code in a .netstandard2.0 project which in turn calls into `System.Drawing.Common` from a .net48 project, things like `PrinterSettings.InstalledPrinters` throws a `PlatformNotSupportedException` exception

After installing `System.Drawing.Common` to the non-SDK project, the issue goes away. This should not be needed

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a non-SDK net48 console app
2. Create a class library
3. Add a reference to `System.Drawing.Common` to the class library
4. Create a method which does something, e.g. `Console.WriteLine(PrintSettings.InstalledPrinters)`
5. Reference the class library from the non-sdk project
6. Call the method created in step 4 from `Main()`
7. Start the console app
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Non-SDK NETFX4.8 project referencing .netstandard2.0 - PlatformNotSupportedException" (#11817)

Issues.Title: In some specific nesting situations, controls aren't properly scaled.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.net 8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

When a control is placed in a SplitContainer inside a TabControl on its second page, this control isn't included in the auto-scaling until after the second page has been created (selected).

The behavior at design time is also affected. To prevent issues during design time, the font size can't be altered from its default.

[TestAutoScaleOnFontChange.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16499800/TestAutoScaleOnFontChange.zip)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Make a form with a TabControl having two tabs. Put some controls inside the SplitContainer in the second tab.
2. When the form is shown, change its font size (OnShown event).
3. Switch to the second tab, the controls are not scaling correctly when they're put inside a SplitContainer.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "In some specific nesting situations, controls aren't properly scaled." (#11816)

Issues.Title: Incorrect scaling of MDI child forms
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.net 8.0, 9.0 Preview6

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

The MDI child form for auto-scaling is using the current font of the MDI parent form instead of default application font. When an MDI child form is shown, it uses the font of its parent but doesn't perform auto-scaling. A possible workaround would be to set the form font in the constructor.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Change font size of the MDI parent form
2. Don't set the font of the MDI child form
3. Open MDI child form
4. Notice the incorrect scaling of controls on the child form.

[TestMDIAudoScaling.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16499712/TestMDIAudoScaling.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorrect scaling of MDI child forms" (#11815)

Issues.Title: The "AutoCompleteSource" property of the TextBox control is missing
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-rc.1.24381.10

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, this is a regression issue. Not reproduce on .NET 7.0

### Issue description

**Actual result:**
The "AutoCompleteSource" property of the TextBox control is missing
![core](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d76e6445-d588-4e4e-a3f2-d6aa26ae3eb3)


**Expected result:**
The "AutoCompleteSource" property of the TextBox control is fully displayed
![6 0](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0f0dc57-84f7-41d9-a058-23bfe970347c)



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms core application with the textbox contorl
2. Click the drop-down button of the "AutoCompleteSource" property of the TextBox control

**More info:**
If click on ListItems, the following error will appear:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/12ca3993-28a4-4569-a6ba-287c2a6bb493)
```
fail: Request failures: Properties/SetValue.
                        Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsServerException: The value AutoCompleteSource.ListItems is not applicable to the TextBox control.

                        For information on how to troubleshoot the designer refer to the guide at https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The "AutoCompleteSource" property of the TextBox control is missing" (#11806)

Issues.Title: The ToolStripMenuItem cannot be deleted successfully using Delete key in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this issue also repro in .NET 9.0 main branch of WinForms repo branch of WinForms repo.

### Issue description

**More info:**
1. This issue cannot repro when using Delete key to delete other control, and then delete ToolStripMenuItem.
2. This issue cannot repro when using Delete in Edit menu.

**Actual result in [[DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole)] test app:**
The ToolStripMenuItem cannot be deleted successfully using Delete key.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/efe0612c-ad63-43e9-898c-001ddc9a2c2e


**Expected result:**
The ToolStripMenuItem can be deleted successfully using Delete key.


### Steps to reproduce


Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The ToolStripMenuItem cannot be deleted successfully using Delete key in the DemoConsole application" (#11794)

Issues.Title: The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo will stop running when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

feature/10.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this was changed after the PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11678

### Issue description

**Actual result in [[DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole))]** test app:
The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo will stop running when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab with **Debug** mode
![GHIssue1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ebb85c0b-5beb-4696-8eb5-f7151383526d)

**Debug Call Stack:**
![Exceptions](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4306a14-66f4-438c-9120-234b34d2d838)

**Expected result:**
The DemoConsole app under the Winforms repo running well when delete the RichTextBox control under ToolStripContainer tab

### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on feature/10.0 branch in Winforms repo on **Debug** mode.

**More info:**
The issue cannot reproduce on **release** mode
![ReleaseMode](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f1e5643-a3a2-47c8-867b-0cabf35f6ec1)
